title: Green Industrial MBA

author: Aleš Dakić, ICPE - International Center for the Promotion of Enterprises

segmentation: So and with this we come to the next presentation of Alice Dockage from International Center for the Promotion of Enterprises Rebana.
He represent the Green Industrial MBA program of AICP.
And so we are now entering the presentations of the economists we executed.
Thank you very much.
I will first say hello to ladies and gentlemen and thank you for attending this conference and especially this.
Is this working a workshop and I would also like to thank today organizers for organizing such a such a wonderful conference.
First, I would like to say that we just discussing which car the other day.

Perhaps it's not the best time to come to Belgrade and talk about climate change when we see the cold weather here, but we said that the issue is not the cold hot weather, but actually the extreme changes.
The current here.
I myself, I'm glad I have not been demonised because I'm a political scientist so far.
So I'm I'm.
I'm glad I've been left out.
But on the other hand, I also finished my master degree in ecological economics.
I do have some.
I'm not aware of the problems of the classical economics because we were taught about the problem of climate change.
I would like to ask you one thing and probably it's quite difficult.
What's our ultimate goal?
Of all people here.
Exactly happiness, maybe mid soundhead nistic, but.
Exactly, yeah, unless you are a hardcore Homer canonicus.
Yeah no I agree.
Is the happiness an how can we achieve this?
I believe we can only achieve this by interdisciplinary approach.
We were just talking about that.
Refer to what Professor McDonald said.
It's it's indispensable.
An the climate change science.
I agree it's a it's an important part.
It's a crucial part of this.
Climate change, but when it stands alone, it doesn't help.
It needs to be used.
In cooperation with other Sciences as well with the current market, economics, chemistry, physics, sociology, political science, etc etc has to be into interwoven into.
Into kind of a science that will understand how it works and how it can be implemented in the society itself.
I strongly agree will go again with Professor Madonna, which set and also the other commentators.
One of the big problems is the communication between scientists from different let's say different fields.
I remember studying.
And ecological economy.

So we also had some natural scientists and when we were discussing as if we were talking some different language, it was we didn't understand each other, and I think that's one of the crucial part to make some of the link.
Connection between different communications, different discourses, different vocabularies.
To introduce kind of interdisciplinary, comprehensive approach that will.
They will be able to attain the high level of happiness, welfare, etc.
Let me first now briefly introduce the International Center for Promotion of Enterprises.
It's been established 35 years ago.
It had 45 Member States, 50 affiliate Member States.
Now it's we have short-term education courses for the public officials of Member States, which are 18 and for the 21 year we run.
An MBA program which is so far educated 600 MBA graduates from 45 Member States.
Why am I talking this?
This is important to understand what we're doing.
We are opening.
It's not actually a new program.
What is new is the synergy between.
The management approach of the International Center for Promotion of Enterprise because the 21 year of experience is in the MBA education.

And on the other hand, the Echo Technology part, which is presented by usual Steven, which is the leading Research Institute with more than 50 years of research excellence in Slovenia and its international postgraduate school.
What's our goal?
Our goal is to educate graduates the week.
Able to construct a competitive, environmentally friendly economy for the higher wealth.
Yeah, of all people.
Anne.
How we going to achieve this?
As we said, climate change affects each and everyone of us.
When the floods are happening in Bangladesh, it affects the rest of the world as well through migration etc.
Must be done on the level of civil society.
Also.
Quite significant changes have been done in the.
Level of policies and policy makers.
Also, certain changes have been done in the business field, but what we're trying to do is.
To change the mindset to change the software of the business.

Sounds revolutionary, but change the software of the business leaders to understand that climate change itself as it's been presented and often misunderstood as an obstacle as a extra unnecessary costs that will limit profits, not bring the welfare, etc.
I think this is wrong.
What we would like to do is actually a twofold approach.
In the 1st place, one is the introduction of the Greening of industry to educate managers of the existing companies, how to introduce certain already existing technologies into the.

Business into the their companies not for the sake of limiting profits, but actually to see it as an opportunity to enhance their profits, such as efficiency, but also the green consumerism is on the rise.
So it's I think quite an important issue to be stressed as well.
That's one approach.
The other one is to.
Demonstrate than yuiko technologies that has not been applied to economic economy but can educate entrepreneurs that are willing.
Dynamic to open new companies to establish new companies that will be able to.
Provides technologies for the benefit of people.
That's basically what we, our goal is also to provide sufficient information of the ever growing.
Pants by the UN European Union and other international institutions.
Um?
And also to educate highly employable graduates, they will be able to find jobs also.
In business government.
NGO's etc.
With a do you understanding of the complexity and interconnectedness of different fields of different?
Usciences Anne.

What we're trying to do is to attract as many international students and possible also for the reason to establish kind of a network of connections of future leaders or companies that will be able to communicate with each other to help each other out.
Um?
Also, we are applying to.
Professors from the leading World University.
Ann would like to do is the globe.
Dispersions of countries know how.
I think I will just finish here.
Uh, I would like to invite you to visit our to visit our web page to contact me and we can.
Just after this meeting we can discuss this and the whole thank you very much for your attention.
Thank you very much Irish.
Are there any questions, comments?
If not so, then we can just one question.
How many similar programs are there in the US or in the did you decide to make a study or searches with it and there's a little?
It's as I said, it's a new synergy.
There is a psychological economics environmental management management, feature, technologies, etc.
But it's such a.
Such a program that would include both the management of the company Monaghan and understanding of Eco Technologies and combine it into.
One of comprehensive with or understanding of how it works.
I must say we haven't found it so far.
Just another question.
Do you think you have achieved that synergy since you mentioned your own experience when people are talking from different sides they are talking by completely different language?
I mean scientists, an economics Anan, people from social Sciences.
I do have the same experience.
So Are you sure that they're not actually sending mixed signals to our students?
Or you think you will or you have achieved that synergy?
It's very interesting concept.
I love it but.
Wouldn't it be a little bit confusing just to talk?
I consider this process of, let's say communication between different fields as a professor at each one of our sets lifelong learning.
It's a process.
I don't expect it can be achieved in one month, two months, but through regular Contacts education, such conferences this I think we can come too.
We can come to terms to establish, let's say a unified vocabulary where we could discuss different issues between the professors between students between students and professors.
As I said, I'm a I'm a political scientist and I must say I don't understand very well when natural scientists aktuna very specialistic terms and get lost.
But yeah, I'm trying to get there.
Perhaps I agree with that.
Thank you very much.
It's an interesting presentation at the head like so to give you some additional information related to your question or some of this question.
There are about 20 different green MBA programs, most of them in America.
There are a few in Europe.
It's an emerging field much you need.
As we heard yesterday, is the business that's going out often.
Take leadership like he's doing in many places in the world in this transformation, because they see a good business case for going green.
V at the girls University.
Currently chairing the Alliance of Central Eastern European Universities, which has membership from a different countries and only last month.
We had a big workshop in pressure in Slovakia and we made the decision to go and develop green MBA program as partners in the region with students being able to take a semester of courses.
It's a number of different institutions.
And I think we need to discuss how we can cooperate further and then get together on the on the same issue.
It's an important field I think, especially in this region becausw industry in the West is beginning to take that on board the the way things are going here.
It's many years into the future, so we need to speed it up.
Wait wait wait.
As brief as possible.
I mean, I'm dealing in the UN country team with the circled green economy.
Container and scratching a bit of surface of the green.
There's a lot of business as usual behind it.
Sorry, but I still don't see.
The I mean the the change in the way of doing things.
I hope you have a different perspective.
I mean I just visited the mosai automobilia here in Belgrade and there's a wonderful Porsche 924 methanol propelled.
It was designed by Serbian engineer for Porsche in 1974.
Well, nothing happened so far.
It works perfectly.
Thank you very much for this question.
And we hope so.
We definitely would like to do is to teach, educate, not the economy as such as a classical kind of account with an economy and economics that will also include the understanding of externalities.
The additional costs.
Also, as I said, a way to actually earn money or save money by going green.
It's not just.
Yeah, it's not just because it should not be understand as.
OK, now it's we have to stress the environmental part.
OK, it's an extra cost etc.
If we are successful, I think it's all the also depends on the students themselves, how, how SEPTA Dash.
Yeah, just very very, very briefly, I think that the key to success of programs like this is getting the economies to think long-term.
Shifting from compliance mode to risk management mode, and we dealt with the problem, so I think it's very good chance of success.
